column1: the opener runs at Irfan and he begins with an off-side wide
shortish and swerves back in, cramps the batsman on the cut, and beats the bat
Livingstone advances and jabs the ball away towards mid-on
Babar opens his PSL season with a cracking boundary. Short and wide outside off, he gets up on his toes and flays it away to the left of backward point for four
back of a length and slanting away outside off, run down to deep third man for one
Livingstone advances down the track, adjusts to a short ball outside off, and squeezes it away to point
Livingstone jumps down the track again and works a single to the leg side to round out the over
skidding down the leg side, Livingstone falls over the flick, leg-side wide
pushed through on middle and leg, patted down to long-on off the front foot
slower through the air and finishes around off, guided away towards point
straighter one on middle, knocked away to midwicket from the crease
much slower and dangled up on middle, nurdled to the leg side again
flatter and faster, on the pads, whipped away through square leg. Babar passes 3000 T20 runs
dragged down on middle, pulled away off the back foot to deep midwicket
Babar shuffles across off and whips a full ball to deep midwicket
on a length and outside off, tip and run to point
short and outside off, slower short ball, shovel-pulled away to deep square leg
shortish and around off, cramps the batsman for room, but he manages to chop down to third man
length ball angling in on middle, Livingstone clears his front leg and muscles it away wide of midwicket for four
slower cutter outside off, worked away towards midwicket
pushed through on middle and leg, slog-swept away to deep midwicket
slid through outside off, down the track and forced through extra-cover. There's a direct hit at the bowler's end, but no harm done for Karachi
drifting down the leg side, tickled away fine of short fine leg
yorker on off, squeezed down back to the bowler
non-turner on the leg stump, pretty full, Livingstone drops down to one knee and smites a slog-sweep over square leg
flatter and outside off, bunted away to the leg side off the back foot for a double
back of a length and angling into a back-foot flick to the right of midwicket
Livingstone jumps down the track and yorks himself, ends up jamming the ball to cover
hip-high slower ball outside off, possibly an offcutter, short-armed away to deep midwicket
back of a length and skids back in, Babar chops an inside edge that wanders away past the leg stump. Another cutter from Junaid
Babar shuffles across and picks one away one past short fine leg for four. Lovely wristwork
on a length and outside off, whisked away towards point
short and wide outside off, flat-batted down to mid-off
in-between length from Irfan, angling in and straightening away past the big drive of Babar
back of a length and outside off, the ball isn't coming onto the bat, stabbed to the covers
back of a length and outside off, forced away to the left of extra-cover
pitched up and outside off, Babar edges a drive through vacant slip to the third-man boundary
pitched up and outside off, another drive, and an outside edge streaks down to third man
slides on outside off, full, driven through the line to sweeper cover off the front foot
arm ball outside off, not short enough for the cut, skids past the bat
Livingstone leans back, slides one off the face to short third man
Babar jumps down the track and whips it away between deep midwicket and wide long-on. He was looking for two but gets four in the end
full and straight, driven through midwicket
Livingstone dashes down the track, reaches the pitch of a full ball and belts it away to the long-on boundary
back of a length and just a shade outside off, whipped away to deep square
Clattered over the midwicket boundary. Livingstone shimmies out and splices it away, enough to find the fence on the leg side
really full on off, down the track and driven down to long-on
dug in short on middle, slower off the pitch, swatted away between deep midwicket and wide long-on for another boundary
banged in short on middle, hooked over square leg. Spliced away
slower cutter, knocked away into the leg side
skidder, on off, chopped away off the back foot to point
on the pads, deflected away fine of short fine leg
uses his feet and punches a single down to long-on
pushed through outside off and breaks away further, chopped to backward point
down the track and slogged to deep midwicket off the inside half of the bat
googly, off the pad and rolls to the leg side, it would have missed leg stump
full on middle, driven down to long-on
short on off, chopped away to backward point
on a length on middle, Livingstone surges down the track and sends the white ball sailing over the long-on boundary
back of a length and outside off, muscled away to the left of deep midwicket
short and outside off, punched away to wide long-on
pitched up and outside off, driven straight of long-on
dropped short and outside off, lashed away to sweeper cover off the back foot
speared down the leg side, Afridi saw Livingstone jumping down the track, deflected away fine of short fine leg for four. Seam-up from Afridi
What a way to bring up a fifty, Livingstone! He launches it over the sightscreen. Down the track, reaches the pitch and unleashes a smooth swing. Not many can run at Afridi
arm ball on middle, chopped away to the off side
Livingstone dares to use his feet, again, shorter and outside off, squeezed towards the covers
googly, uses his feet and pushes it down to long-on. Afridi pats Livingstone on the back. Nice to see that
Livingstone ventures down the track and yorks himself, drawing an lbw appeal from Ilyas. Might have hit the moving batsman outside the line.
yorker on middle, well bowled, jammed to the covers
on a length and outside off, Babar aims to run down to third man and misses
back of a length on middle, punched down to long-on
full-toss on middle, slapped back at the bowler, bursts through hands of Ilyas. Half-chance missed
rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and guides it down to deep third man
on a length and outside off, punchily driven to the left of mid-off
knocked into the leg side and Babar brings up a fifty off 39 balls
Blasted down the ground. Livingstone wears a sheepish little smile after putting his partner in the firing line. Drilled away and Babar ducks out of the way
on a length and outside off, carved away to deep point
back of a length and angling across off, punched on the up to extra-cover
looks like a slower ball on middle, down the track and chipped over Irfan
back of a length and outside off, run down to third man
pitched up and outside off, driven down to long-on
swatted down to long-on
pretty full and shoved down the leg side for a wide
short and wide outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
One-handed six from Livingstone, Arthur loves it in the dug out. Very full on off, seam-up, Livingstone yanks the bottom hand off the bat and lifts it over the long-off boundary
slower short ball outside off, Livingstone sizes it up and smokes it over the midwicket boundary. Bam!
hip-high short ball, Babar gets inside the line and swats it away to the right of deep square leg. Three boundaries in a row
back of a length and angling in on middle, tapped down to long-on
really full on middle, Livingstone gets underneath the length and just toe-ends it away. Enough to clear the long-on boundary
wide yorker, squeezed away to the covers
wide yorker, Babar can't run it down to third man
slower short ball outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket
tossed up and angling away outside off, carved up and over extra-cover. Oh, man down. Babar is down. Is he suffering from cramps?
floated up outside off, full, Babar ventures down the track and thumps it straight over Green's head. This is now the highest stand for any wicket in the PSL
fired outside off, slapped through extra-cover
off-side wide
tossed up on middle, Livingstone ventures a slog-sweep. He gets more height as opposed to distance. Holes out to wide long-on. It was good while it lasted. In fact, it was fantastic
flat and wide outside off, speared away to deep point
on the pads, picked away to deep square leg
shortish and outside off, dragged away to wide long-on
wide yorker, jammed to short third man
full on the stumps, squeezed down to wide long-on. They hare back for the second
yorker on middle, hit down to long-on
Russell slips in a slower short ball outside off. Ingram reads the change-up but swings it straight into the lap of deep square leg
down the track, Russell pulls his length back and bowls a slower ball that is flat-batted away to wide long-on
very full and outside off, shovelled to wide long-on
flighted on middle, drilled down to long-off
pushed through outside off, forced down to long-on
full-toss on middle, down the track and hit down to long-off
Babar picks out deep midwicket. Looped up on middle, the batsman leans back and tugs it straight into the lap of Masood
pushed through on the leg stump, Green hits a hard length and has Imad Wasim holing out to long-on. What an over from Green. Just four runs and two wickets off it
back of a length and skids back in off the pitch, played back to the bowler
yorker on middle, squeezed to point
really full on middle and leg, forced down to long-on
back of a length and outside off, drags it back to the bowler off the toe end
full and wide outside off, reaches out for the ball and slices it away to sweeper cover for a double
leg-stump yorker, inside-edged away behind square on the leg side

Junaid Khan rolls his fingers across a cutter, short and outside off. Raza had no clue, stepping out, swinging and missing. The keeper tracks down the ball and disturbs the stumps to catch Raza short. Well short
Rizwan jumps across off and searches for a lap-sweep, the bowler follows him and goes shorter to defeat the batsman. They've crossed over for a leg bye, though
near yorker on off, jammed down to long-on
full-toss angling away outside off, Rizwan reaches out for the ball and slices it to Imad Wasim to deep third man. Good catch in the outfield, Hammad runs in and completes the catch diving forward
slower ball outside off, tugged away to deep square leg for one. Sohail Khan will face the last ball of the innings
Sohail finishes the innings with a four. He stands tall, meets a length ball outside off, possibly a slower one, and swings it baseball style down the ground
back of a length and outside off, no turn, worked off the back foot through midwicket
tossed up on the pads, knocked into the leg side again
flatter and fired outside off, jabbed away to long-on
back of a length on off, played back to the bowler from the crease
pushed through outside off and drifts away past the outside edge
pushed through and attacking the stumps again, played back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, past the tramline, off-side wide from Amir
back of a length and bending away outside off, Masood wafts and is beaten on the outside edge
on a length and snakes away against the angle again, keeps low, and sneaks under the cut
back of a length and angling into a leg-side flick to deep midwicket
Moores dances down the track, swings down the wrong line, and is beaten outside off

Amir draws a leading edge and Ingram throws himself forward from extra-cover to pluck it inches from the ground. Wonderful catch. Credit to Amir, too, for venturing a cutter that sticks in the pitch. Moores eyes up the leg side and winds up chipping a catch. That it was a catch was down to Ingram's athletic intervention
on a length on middle, driven to mid-on's right
shorter and outside off, leans back and slashes it to point
whipped from off stump to wide long-on off the front foot
full on middle, worked away in front of square on the leg side
arm ball, snakes in to hit the pad, but this is clearly heading down the leg side
nice and full on off, no room to free the arms, jabbed back to Imad
tossed on middle, eased down to long-on for one
slower cutter, tickled away on the bounce to the keeper
back of a length on middle, Evans loosens his grip and secures a single to cover
just short of a good length and outside off, worked away to the midwicket region
back of a length and angling across off, seam-up ball, a back-foot punch to extra-cover ensues
pitched up and outside off, Evans stays leg-side of the ball and pumps it over extra-cover
off-stump yorker, which is dug out to point
Masood makes some room, quick fizzer from Imad following the moving batsman. Masood can't touch it
Masood ventures down the track and hoists it on the up over extra-cover. Lovely piece of timing and footwork from Masood
pushed through outside off, driven to mid-off
down the track and cracked away to backward point, where the fielder makes a tumbling save to his right
back of a length on middle, whipped away to square leg
skidder on middle, punched down to long-on
banged in short and outside off, Evans leaps, gets on top of it and nails a pull to the midwicket boundary. Hit powerfully
short on middle and leg, punched off the back foot to midwicket
slower offcutter, drifted down the leg side, wide
pitched up and outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
short on the hips with fine leg inside the circle, legcutter, pulled away square of that fielder for four
overpitched and outside off, shovelled away with the bottom hand through point for four. Glorious shot from Evans
pushed through outside off, down the track and crunched away to the left of Umar
an appeal for lbw, but this is shot down as the batsman had gloved a reverse-sweep
back of a length on leg stump, stabbed back to the bowler
Masood shimmies out and deflects the ball away towards square leg. Rizwan swoops down on the ball but can't throw the stumps down
skids on outside off, zips off the pitch, and beats the cut
non-turner on off, opens the face and glides it to point
short and into the hips, tucked away to long leg's right
back of a length and angling into the hips from wide of the crease, tickled to short fine leg
on a length and outside off, slower ball, skewed off a leading edge over extra-cover
on a length and outside off, punched past the bowler to long-on
good length on off, keeps low, guided to short third man
on a length and outside off, forced to midwicket
fractionally short and outside off, punched through the line to extra-cover, where Imad throws himself to his left and stops the ball

Maiden T20 wicket for Umer. He wheels away to deep midwicket to celebrate with Amir who took the catch there in the outfield. Masood pre-meditates a big hit. He shimmies out, but is nowhere close to the pitch, and winds up dragging it away to Amir in the deep
pushed through outside off, driven off the front foot to extra-cover
straighter one, played back to Umer
whipped from the stumps to the right of long-on
full and outside off, tip and run to cover
back of a length on middle, punched down to long-on

short and skids back in to cramp the batsman and mess with his pull. The ball rolls back Usman Khan. Usman chances a review, but this is surely missing leg stump or bouncing over leg stump. The tracker confirms it would have missed leg stump
wide of the crease, short and homing in at the chest, Malik fends it away to the leg side
wide of the crease, again, swerves back in on middle, jammed back down the pitch
yorker, bending in from wide of the crease, dug out back to the bowler
short and outside off, flat-batted down to long-on
short and outside off, leans back and chops the ball to point
Malik uses his feet, the bowler spears it shorter and wider, slapped to extra-cover
length ball on off, Evans drops down to one knee and executes the scoop to perfection. He gets it over Rizwan behind the stumps
down the track and punched down to long-off
whipped off the pads to deep square leg
short and skids on outside off, chopped to point
just short of a good length and outside off, punched up to extra-cover
back of a length and outside off, forced to deep midwicket off the back foot
back of a length and outside off, uses his feet and scoops a leading edge to point
back of a length on middle, shovelled away to wide long-on with the bottom hand
full and angling into strike the pad as Malik can't get the flick away. Evans needs to go big
wide yorker, and Evans adjusts to it, carving it away through point for four
short and outside off, chopped behind to the keeper
on a length and outside off, Malik reaches out and chips it over extra-cover. Three men circle around the ball in the outfield, which results in some chaos, but they save the boundary in the end
really full on middle, squeezed down to long-off

short, wide, scythed away to the left of sweeper cover. Ingram slides to his left and saves the boundary. Top fielding from Ingram. Oh wait, replays suggest Ingram had crashed into the ad boards with the ball in his hand
on a length and outside off, Malik tees off. He holds his shape and launches it over the long-on boundary - first six of the innings
short and wide outside off, chopped away to extra-cover
slower, short ball outside off from Bopara. Malik picks it up, leans back, and pulls the knuckle ball away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
Bopara sprays it on the pads with fine leg inside the circle. Picked away past that fielder
Make that five boundaries in six balls! Back of a length and outside off, Malik hangs back and punches with an open face behind point. Delectable timing from Malik
on a length and outside off, Malik is on fayaaaaah in Dubai. He races down the track and ends up slicing the ball over cover-point

Boom! Malik muscles it into the sightscreen. Full and outside off, Malik stretches out and hoists it in the air to the right of long-off and over the boundary. Back-of-the-hand variety from Bopara. Dispatched
The under-pressure Bopara nails a middle-stump yorker, jabbed away to the leg side
short and outside off, Evans gives himself room and scythes it to wide long-off
short and skids back in, worked away to the midwicket region. Another hard-run two from Malik and Evans
short and outside off, Malik leans back and punches to backward point to raise a 24-ball fifty
length ball on off, Evans clears his front leg and golf-swings it straight down the ground for another boundary. Mighty blow

A run-out provides Karachi with a timely breakthrough. Evans gives himself some room, swings, off the pad and rolls behind to the keeper. Evans was ball-watching even as Malik was scampering across to the other end. Evans takes off late, Usman collects the ball and completes the run-out at his end
shortish and outside off, punched up to point
back of a length on middle, Russell stands tall and squirts the ball away behind square on the leg side off the inside edge
Russell loads up, Amir darts it past the tramline. Off-side wide
Amir hits a hard length on leg stump, cramps Russell, off the pad to the keeper
full-toss on middle, clears his front leg and flays it down to long-off
banged in short down the leg side, wide
back of a length and on off stump, punched down to long-on
Tonked into the deserted stands beyond square leg. Russell opens up his hips and smashes this length ball into oblivion. Launched into the second tier
another off-side wide as Russell moves around in the crease and throws Amir off

Amir has Russell nicking off. What a big moment in the game. Amir goes very full and wide outside off, Russell, who had stepped away outside leg, is forced to reach out for the ball. He only feathers it behind to the keeper
really full on middle, clipped away to deep midwicket
pitched up and outside off, shovelled away to wide long-on

Pulled straight into the lap of deep midwicket. Raza takes the pressure catch in the outfield. Slower, short ball outside off. Malik aims a pull but only drags it away to Raza, who completes a fine tumbling catch
bouncer from wide of the crease, Afridi ducks under it and ignores it
dug in short on off, Afridi attempts a pull and top-edges it fine of long leg for four
full-toss on off, Afridi drags the ball to long-on
Afridi jumps across off, gets inside the line of a full ball on middle, and whips it away over square leg for four
back of a length on middle, Afridi smites it away between deep midwicket and long-on for back-to-back fours
full and speared in following Afridi who was feigning to make room. Off the pad and sneaks away to cover. Afridi slaps the bat on his pad in frustration
fullish and outside off, Azam leans back to find elevation. Lifted over mid-off inside the circle
slower short ball on middle, Azam reads the change-up. He rocks back and pummels it away over deep midwicket. Clears the leaping fielder. Such a clean strike from Azam
really full and angling into the pads, glanced away to long leg
pitched up and outside off, driven hard but straight to mid-off
Afridi runs down the track, Amir hits the top of middle stump. Afridi swings and collects only thin air. Amir hits his target and celebrates as this game continues to twist and turn wildly
near-yorker on off, jammed to cover
slower offcutter from Amir, Azam slog-sweeps and misses. Off the back thigh and rolls away to the off side
yorker on middle, dug out to point. Amir puts a smile on Arthur's face and elicits applause from his coach

full-toss angling away outside off, Azam goes for a big hit - he has to - he bends his back knee can't clear Livingstone at long-off. Sparkling little cameo from Azam, but he can't get his side over the line. Just two wickets and four runs off the penultimate over from Amir. Gold
very full and angling into the pads, glanced away to the right of long leg for a double
near yorker, Green goes low and carves it away past extra-cover and scampers back for the second
Green holes out to long-on. Excellent catch running in from Ingram. Slower offcutter, short on middle, messes up with the pull. Spliced to Ingram in the end
Sohail lets out an almighty roar after hitting the stumps. This isn't a yorker, though. Really full on middle, swerves in, Ilyas swings across the line but can't touch the ball
on a length and outside off, flat-batted away to the left of wide long-off for four. Too little, too late for Multan Sultans
pitched up and outside off, Irfan winds up for the leg-side slog.... and misses
